title: Interactive Valentine Letter single-page experience

requirements.text: Create a single-page Valentine Letter UI that initially shows an envelope element with the label ‚ÄúClick to Open üíå‚Äù, and on click hides the envelope and reveals the letter content.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the envelope is visible and the letter is not visible.
Clicking/tapping the envelope hides the envelope and shows the letter without a page reload.
The interaction works with both mouse and touch input.

requirements.text: Render the letter text exactly as provided (line-by-line paragraphs), in English, using a styled card layout that matches the original intent (soft pink page background, white letter card, readable text).

acceptanceCriteria: All paragraphs appear in the same order as the provided HTML.
The letter container is visually distinct from the page background (card styling with padding and rounded corners).
Text is readable on both mobile and desktop (no horizontal overflow).

requirements.text: Implement the envelope and letter styling using Tailwind CSS (or existing Tailwind setup) to approximate the provided CSS: centered layout, soft pink background, envelope card with rounded corners and subtle shadow, and letter card with subtle shadow.
acceptanceCriteria: The page background is a light pink tone.
The envelope element appears as a centered clickable card with rounded corners and a shadow.
The letter card has a white background, rounded corners, and a shadow similar to the envelope.

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, creative visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and micro-interactions) appropriate for a Valentine letter, and enforce it consistently across the page without adding new product features.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI uses a consistent color palette and typography (not default browser styling).
Interactive states are present (e.g., hover/active/focus styling on the envelope element).
The theme does not rely on blue/purple as primary colors.

constraints: Frontend must remain a single-page experience (no multi-page routing required for this request).
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose and use them if needed instead.
nonGoals: Persisting the letter or click state to the backend.
Multiple letters, editing, sharing, or messaging features.
